content.text:
Resume


   

Contact
mark.manthy@gmail.com

www.linkedin.com/in/markmanthy
(LinkedIn)
luminasolar.com/commercial/
(Company)

Top Skills
community solar
solar development
Solar System Design

English (Native or Bilingual)
Ukrainian (Limited Working)
Russian (Professional Working)
German (Limited Working)
Kazakh (Elementary)

Certifications
OSHA 10 Hour
NABCEP PV Technical Sales

Mark Manthy
Director of Business Development at Lumina Solar
Washington DC-Baltimore Area

Summary
Mark Manthy is an accomplished solar professional and the
Commercial Director for Lumina Solar, a full-service EPC serving
the Mid-Atlantic region. With over 14 years of experience in the solar
industry, Mark has established himself as a respected leader in
all aspects of solar project development, from site assessment to
design, financing, installation, and maintenance.

As the Director of the commercial division, Mark has played a pivotal
role in building the division from the ground up, leading to impressive
sales growth year over year. He oversees all aspects of the solar
project lifecycle, including site development, system design, cost and
pricing, contract review and execution, project management, and
post-installation O&M.  His commitment to excellence and attention
to detail have earned him a reputation as a trusted advisor to clients
across the Mid-Atlantic and beyond.

Mark's specialties include Community Solar, low-income (LMI)
solar projects, project development, financial analysis, and system
design and pricing.   Mark was also involved in the development
and installation of the first community solar system in the District
of Columbia in 2016 . This project demonstrated his ability to lead
complex and innovative projects from conception to completion.

Mark has deep developer and financier relationships, enabling
him to provide comprehensive solutions to clients, tailored to their
unique needs and requirements. These relationships, combined with
his extensive experience and knowledge of the policy landscape,
incentives, and regulations in the region, make him a valuable asset
to developers, financiers, and businesses looking to capitalize on the
vibrant Mid-Atlantic solar market.

Mark holds an MBA from the University of Maryland and a BS
from Boston College and was a Peace Corps Volunteer in Almaty,
Kazakhstan, from 1997 to 1999. His education and experience have

equipped him with the skills and knowledge necessary to navigate
the complex and rapidly evolving solar energy landscape. He is
dedicated to advancing the industry and promoting sustainable

Experience

Lumina Solar
4 years 2 months

Director of Business Development
June 2023 - Present (1 year 4 months)
Baltimore, Maryland, United States

Commercial Sales Leader
August 2020 - June 2023 (2 years 11 months)
Baltimore, Maryland, United States

Urban Ingenuity
Director of Solar Project Development
January 2019 - August 2020 (1 year 8 months)
Washington, DC

SolarGaines
Director of Business Development
October 2015 - January 2019 (3 years 4 months)
Baltimore, MD

Solargaines is a Maryland owned and operated solar installer with over
thirty years of local experience in the construction business.  With several
megawatts installed throughout Maryland, Virginia and Washington, DC,
Solargaines is uniquely qualified to custom design-build a solar project for your
home or business.  

What started as experimental and very pricey has now become a smart
financial and lifestyle decision.  Solar represents a natural evolution in
construction, financing, and efficiency.  We’ve assembled a very smart team,
acquired the best technology, and we’re grounding everything in some rather
old fashioned values of service, hard work, honesty and respect.

If you're considering solar for your home or business, it would be my pleasure
to see how we can help.

  Page 2 of 4



   

Direct Energy Solar
2 years 3 months

Director of Strategic Partnerships
February 2015 - October 2015 (9 months)
Columbia, MD

Design and implement programs enabling Direct Energy Services in-home
brands to identify and share leads with Direct Energy Solar creating non-
competitive, internally sourced leads for solar sales teams.

Commercial Sales Director
August 2013 - February 2015 (1 year 7 months)
Annapolis Junction, MD

Prospected and closed over 1 mW of non-financed commercial solar
installations without financing, lease, or PPA agreement.

Primarily focused on small to mid-sized commercial opportunities (30kW to 500
kW) within Mid-Atlantic and Metro NY/CT markets.

Developed a deep network in mid-Atlantic real estate communities as well as
sustainability and efficiency oriented groups.

Astrum Solar
3 years 6 months

Business Development Manager
October 2012 - August 2013 (11 months)
Annapolis Junction, MD

Identified and developed non-traditional lead sources including non-profits,
ancillary service providers, professional partners and retail.

Built and managed homebuilder sales channel focusing on small to mid-sized
homebuilders.

Managed team of three salespeople in finite solarize program with close rate
over 40%.

Continued to sell residential projects as needed, particularly in times when
company needed immediate cash.

NABCEP Certified Solar Sales Executive
March 2010 - October 2012 (2 years 8 months)

  Page 3 of 4



   

I was the Mid-Atlantic region's top producing representative in 2012. In 2011 I
led the entire company in sales volume and revenue, and was one of the top
producing solar salesperson in the entire state of Maryland. 

President's Club 2010, 2011, and 2012.

Corporate Executive Board
Sales Executive
2008 - 2009 (1 year)

Sold complex, executive research and advisory services face-to-face to  C-
Level IT and Finance Executives at Fortune 500 companies in the US and
Canada by developing customized sales presentations based on market
research, company history, and existing internal relationships.

Almaty, Kazakhstan

parts: All the files uploaded by the user have been fully loaded. Searching won't provide additional information.

Here is a cleaned-up version of the LinkedIn profile for Mark Manthy:

---

### **Mark Manthy**
**Director of Business Development at Lumina Solar**  
Washington DC-Baltimore Area

#### **Summary**
Mark Manthy is a seasoned solar professional with over 14 years of experience in the solar industry. As the Commercial Director at Lumina Solar, a full-service EPC serving the Mid-Atlantic region, Mark has been instrumental in building the commercial division from the ground up. He has a proven track record in all aspects of solar project development, including site assessment, design, financing, installation, and maintenance.

Mark's specialties include Community Solar, low-income (LMI) solar projects, project development, financial analysis, and system design. His notable achievements include leading the development and installation of the first community solar system in the District of Columbia in 2016, showcasing his ability to handle complex and innovative projects.

With strong relationships with developers and financiers, Mark provides tailored solar solutions that meet clients' unique needs. His in-depth knowledge of regional policy, incentives, and regulations makes him a valuable asset in the vibrant Mid-Atlantic solar market.

Mark holds an MBA from the University of Maryland and a BS from Boston College. He also served as a Peace Corps Volunteer in Kazakhstan from 1997 to 1999, further enriching his leadership and cross-cultural skills.

#### **Experience**

**Lumina Solar**  
*Baltimore, Maryland, United States*  
- **Director of Business Development** (June 2023 – Present)  
- **Commercial Sales Leader** (August 2020 – June 2023)

**Astrum Solar**  
*Annapolis Junction, MD*  
- **Business Development Manager** (October 2012 – August 2013)  
- **NABCEP Certified Solar Sales Executive** (March 2010 – October 2012)

**Corporate Executive Board**  
*Washington, DC*  
- **Sales Executive** (2008 – 2009)

**Peace Corps Kazakhstan**  
*Almaty, Kazakhstan*  
- **Peace Corps Volunteer** (May 1997 – July 1999)

#### **Education**
- **MBA, Marketing and Business Development**  
*University of Maryland - Robert H. Smith School of Business* (2006 – 2008)
- **BS, Marketing**  
*Boston College* (1993 – 1997)
- **Marketing, Germanic Studies**  
*Technische Universität Dresden* (1996)

#### **Skills**
- Community Solar, Solar Development, Solar System Design

#### **Languages**
- English (Native), Russian (Professional), Ukrainian (Limited Working), German (Limited Working), Kazakh (Elementary)

#### **Certifications**

- NABCEP PV Technical Sales

#### **Contact**

- LinkedIn: [linkedin.com/in/markmanthy](https://www.linkedin.com/in/markmanthy)  
- Company: [luminasolar.com/commercial](https://luminasolar.com/commercial/)

please write a paragraph about sponsoring 7 Ukrainian refugees including resource navigation, employment acquisition, cultural integration and ongoing support and mentorship

Mark Manthy has demonstrated a deep commitment to humanitarian efforts by sponsoring seven Ukrainian refugees, providing them with critical support and guidance during their resettlement in the United States. He has actively assisted in navigating essential resources such as housing, healthcare, and education, ensuring a smooth transition for each individual. Mark has played a pivotal role in employment acquisition, leveraging his network to secure job opportunities tailored to their skills and experience. He has also facilitated cultural integration, helping them adapt to their new environment through language support, community involvement, and cultural exchange activities. His ongoing support and mentorship have fostered a sense of belonging and empowerment, enabling these individuals to rebuild their lives and contribute positively to their new communities.
please simplify qnd make factual no superlatives

Mark Manthy has sponsored seven Ukrainian refugees, providing support in navigating essential resources such as housing, healthcare, and education. He has helped them find employment by connecting them with job opportunities suited to their skills and experience. Mark has also supported their cultural integration through language assistance and involvement in community activities. He continues to provide guidance and mentorship to help them adjust to their new environment and build their lives in the United States.
plaese do not tell in third person

I have sponsored seven Ukrainian refugees, helping them navigate essential resources such as housing, healthcare, and education. I’ve assisted in finding employment by connecting them with job opportunities that match their skills and experience. I’ve also supported their cultural integration through language assistance and community involvement. I continue to provide guidance and mentorship to help them adjust to their new environment and build their lives in the United States.
indicate they are thriving and living independent lives

I have sponsored seven Ukrainian refugees, helping them navigate essential resources like housing, healthcare, and education. I’ve assisted them in finding employment by connecting them with job opportunities that match their skills and experience and supported their cultural integration through language assistance and community involvement. Through ongoing guidance and mentorship, they are now thriving and living independent lives, successfully adapting to their new environment and contributing to their communities in the United States.
include emphasis on self reliance and integration

I have sponsored seven Ukrainian refugees, helping them navigate essential resources such as housing, healthcare, and education. I’ve worked with them to find employment opportunities that align with their skills and experience and have supported their cultural integration through language assistance and community activities. My focus has been on fostering self-reliance and helping them build the confidence to navigate their new environment independently. As a result, they are now thriving, living independent lives, and fully integrated into their communities in the United States.
remove supported cultural integration and say something about acclimating them to their new lives in the US and navigating the beueacracy

I have sponsored seven Ukrainian refugees, helping them navigate essential resources such as housing, healthcare, and education. I’ve worked with them to find employment opportunities that align with their skills and experience while also assisting them in acclimating to their new lives in the U.S. and navigating the necessary bureaucracy. My focus has been on fostering self-reliance and building their confidence to manage their new environment independently. As a result, they are now thriving, living independent lives, and contributing to their communities.
